pros: Small university with a very well developed adult studies program

review_title: Challanges, but wish I was still there!
pros: Faculty and staff are so friendly! I had a great team and department that supported each other. They made me feel so welcome. I did not have many students, but I enjoyed working with them. I had a wonderful and supportive Dean!
cons: The university was facing some very challenging financial situations that I was not aware of. On-top of that COVID hit right when I came and that did not help.I left out of fear of being laid off and was trying to be proactive. I probably would have been fine though and wish I would have stayed. The move to SNU was so good for the family!

job_title: Library Director in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Very friendly staff to work with
cons: Did not discuss major decisions with you

pros: Generally very committed staff and faculty who feel a mission.  Most faculty are very qualified, and love their work.  You are able to get time off quite easily.  You work with many super colleagues.  Some good benefit options.  You can get a super education at the university.
cons: The top administration is generally neither creative nor appreciative of what those below are doing, and will easily blame others and stab them in the back.  The president is totally incapable of accepting blame or responsibility and hand picks all below him expecting their loyalty instead of their experience, insight or ability.  The culture is quite ingrown and unresponsive to real change and infiltrated by cronyism.  Most are afraid of instituting real change because it will be overturn by the top administrator.  The grand illusion by the top administrator to become a football power has squashed academics.  Salaries are poor and not competitive.

pros: The people you interact with day to day are wonderful kind people. You get two weeks off for Christmas while the campus is closed and it is normally easy to take you other vacation days whenever you would like during the school year. They do like to hire from within for promotions.
cons: Their is a glut of high paid executive leadership, while most of the support staff is paid under 20K a year. There are no raises for performance or even inflation. You will make the same the entire time you work for the company until you either leave or move into a different position. This only applies to staff positions. Faculty are on a different system and do get lots of merit raises. Also the top leadership does not make decisions off of evidence and data, but instead off of gut and his whims. He likes horses so we have a horse barn. He likes football so we build a new stadium. All while academics suffer and retention remains abysmal.

review_title: Full of Characters, Weird Culture, and Can't Find Christ...
pros: Tuition remission for employees and families.
cons:
Character - There are bullies at this school in all levels and they are not reprimanded, laid off, or fired, because it wouldn't be Christ-like or it would be too much work. Good employees become cynical and bitter or leave before they can be changed by the environment. Also, some people can get away with a lot of incompetence and bullying behavior based on what their last name is or who they are related too. 

Culture - The school covers up its issues instead of dealing (racism issues from the past two years and poor money management are two examples). Forget the idea that working hard will get you promotions or raises. It's not about "Not having a money tree" - it's called managing a business for long-term growth and retaining competent and valuable employees. Also, a new lifestyle covenant came out that caused an uproar at first. It's since been changed to basically be the old one with newer vocabulary, but not before losing many valuable faculty and staff.

Christ - There are few good examples of what it is to be Christ-like in this school. These are often overwhelmed with issues like gossip, back-stabbing, narcissism,  and generally un-Christ-like behaviors.

pros: They are very laid back place to work.
cons: They pay their employees very little and require them to take on multi jobs that they were not hired on to do. They see their employees to be expendable. They do not see anyone as a value. They have not given a cost of living raise in fives years, but continues to make up date to  and add new builds to the campus. This company is too laid back they do not put the students and their families first. Wake up people this is the reason you are in busy. The people that you see as not being any value are the ones who are trying to solve problem they are more important than the new science building or new doors being added to old building. Character, Culture, Christ I have a hard time seeing this being lived out on the campus. You are only worried about the number of students instead of the quality that you are providing these students and employees. Without students and employees you would not be a university. Prioritizes  and reevaluate your values and living out Character, Culture, Christ.

review_title: Loved the job, not the pay
pros: Family friendly work environment.  Good health insurance.  Tuition Remission for self and immediate family.
cons: VERY low pay.  Upper level tends to have their heads in the sand when it comes to day to day operations and best practices.  Things only change when a major problem occurs and they change very slowly.  Good employees leave due to poor employees taking advantage of the niceness of management.

pros:
Working at SNU is unique! It is a community of family and friends with a common goal of serving and helping students, faculty and staff to reach their potential. It is an opportunity to be a part of something worthwhile where you can make a difference in the lives of others. There are many opportunities to serve the local community and the world. It is an exciting place to be.
There are great benefits such as retirement, insurance and tuition remission.
cons: If you are in it for the salary, you will not be content. The benefits are key here.

review_title: Great people to work with however the salary is not competitive nor do they pay based on an increased cost of living.
job_title: Financial Aid Counselor in Bethany, OK
pros: Good benefits. Tuition Remission and several others. Great work environment and love working with the students. Great people to work with love the Christian environment.
cons: Pay scale is not up to speed. Staff positions are extremely underpaid and not much room for advancement. Salaries are not changed as the cost of inflation does.

review_title: Good environment with nice people, very low pay for amount of work contributed.
pros: Benefits. Easy to get time off. Nice people. Corporate culture is friendly. Christian atmosphere. The retirement plan is good, as well as the benefit of having your children get their college for free if you have worked there 4 years.
cons: incompetent administration. there is a good ol' boy network. It is hard for the people in IT who know what they are doing to convince administration that they know what they are doing. Sometimes decisions are made without the consent of the IT department.

pros: There is a strong community at SNU. There are some amazing people who work there that truly care about the students and community.
cons: There is a lot of favoritism that is given to insiders within the staff. The president of the university has worked there for too long and is not engaged with the climate. The school adheres to discriminatory religious stances against LGBTQ+ staff, faculty, and students, this creates a climate of secrecy and frustration on the part of members of the community who are members or allies of this group.

pros: Good environment to work in. Great people work for this University.
cons: Pay is so low its ridiculous. Have to work very hard for no recognition from the president. This University has so many people making big bucks that don't have a significant role. Old and stagnant leadership. Oh the list could go on.

pros: The only pro is the people. I worked with some great Christian people in a Christian atmosphere. The students are great too.
cons: The cons are numerous at SNU. Extremely low pay, overworked, upper management allows certain employees to bully other coworkers and they get away with it. Those types of employees should not be allowed. Period. Upper management has no clue about processes, yet they make the most important decisions that affect everyone else negatively.

pros: Nice people, easy work but plenty to keep you busy. I don't have anything else to add.
cons: Low pay, overtime asked and required sometimes without compensation, eidndjsjddjdjdjdkdkdkds

review_title: SNU is a great place to work!
pros: I have dedicated, friendly co-workers at SNU.  The school in general is committed to excellence in all areas. SNU offers a great education to its students.
cons: The only con to SNU is that it doesn't have a money tree growing in the center of campus.

pros: The community is great. Everyone seems to know almost everyone on campus, which helps build the culture. Flexible hours for the most part.

pros: Wonderful environment, able to fulfill  God's mission for my life
